com.blahti.drag

Class DragController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blahti.drag.DragController

  • public class DragController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to initiate a drag within a view or across multiple views. When a drag starts it creates a special view (a DragView) that moves around the screen until the user ends the drag. As feedback to the user, this object causes the device to vibrate as the drag begins.

    • Method Detail

      • startDrag

        public void startDrag(android.view.View v,
                      DragSource source,
                      java.lang.Object dragInfo,
                      DragController.DragBehavior dragBehavior)
        Starts a drag. It creates a bitmap of the view being dragged. That bitmap is what you see moving. The actual view can be repositioned if that is what the onDrop handle chooses to do.
        Parameters:
        v - The view that is being dragged
        source - An object representing where the drag originated
        dragInfo - The data associated with the object that is being dragged
        dragAction - The drag behavior: move or copy
